results.title: Storm and stress
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and colour and audio
results.brief_description: A line of satellite dishes stretches to the horizon as storm clouds loom overhead. A tornado funnels across a plains landscape at high speed. Through remarkable imagery of majestic natural phenomena, Storm and Stress evokes the beauty, terror and power of the tension between the forces of nature and technology. Hall’s sequences are based on natural elements — air, fire, water — and the industrial counterparts that echo them — wind tunnels, Tesla coils, hydroelectric plants. Hall’s allusions to Sturm und Drang, the 19th-century Romantic aesthetic of the apocalyptic sublime, and the notion of the Pathetic Fallacy, in which natural upheaval reflects the individual’s inner turmoil, are expressed through powerful visual metaphors.

results.title: Bourgeois dictionaries (Private Hungary 7)
results.brief_description:
Forgacs recontextualizes archival home movies and film journals from the 1930s through to the 1950s, taking small moments, individual shots or whole sequences from a variety of sources and editing them together into a mosaic of middle class Hungarian life.

The soundtrack layers political radio broadcasts of the times over the ambient music of Tibor Szemzo, creating a sense of expectancy, of fate. The images however are resolutely concerned with the everyday, the personal, the pleasurable. Tantalising glimpses of cafe society, fur coats, cigars, flirtations, erotic encounters and picnics are interspersed with moments that mark turning points in family life; a father laid in state, poppy seed loaves being baked as a son leaves for the front, a daughter’s first communion.

The 2nd world war is referred to in an incidental way; planes flying over head intercut with the 1944 figure skating championships or a little cat being petted in the bombed out ruins of a building. A catalogue of daily life at once nostalgic and familiar.

results.title: Galerie de portraits
results.creator_credit: Image VidÃ©o, Dominique Loreau and Marie AndrÃ©
results.brief_description: In ‘Galerie de portraits’, Marie Andre sketches the portraits of five women from among her closest friends and family (including her grandmother and daughter), composing an intimate, intensely private space. Her eloquent compositions focus on the quotidian, the richness inherent in such everyday gestures as watering a plant, lighting a cigarette, stirring a cup of tea. A ‘portrait’ of a woman is drawn from a corner of her room, the objects on her table, or the view onto which she gazes from a window. Andre, master of the subtle romance of the everyday, distils only what is essential — still life’s, nuances, spaces, the rhythm of voices — to obliquely portray the personal essence of the women and convey the intimacy between the artist and her female subjects.

results.title: Rachel; Just one of the kids
results.creator_credit: Healthsharing Women. Publishing and Production Group and Tony Paice
results.brief_description: 1. “Rachel” (40 min.) is the story of a young girl with a disability making her transition from a small rural community school to a large country technical school. 2. “Just one of the kids” (20 min.) shows the development of integration in the state school system.

results.title: Victorian education history. - No. 1.
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description:
Three programs which show different periods of school life in Victoria. “A Day at Ascot-Vale School no. 2608” is a silent film showing some of the daily activities at a primary school in the twenties. The second film is silent and untitled, but shows life at a primary school in the 40’s or 50’s. The third film is similarly untitled but is in colour and with sound. It shows different aspects of teaching in Victoria in the 50’s, with a substantial section on teacher training and country schools. “Each one is different” introduces the concept of child-centred education in Victorian schools.

NFSA description:

1. Portrays the outdoor life at a school in Melbourne in the 1920’s. Shows school dress, assembly, physical training organised dancing and games, Junior Red Cross activities, mothers club and school committee. #2. Shows the then new facilities for infant children at South West Brunswick Primary School. #3. A teacher recruitment film for the Victorian Education Dept. Describes the training of primary teachers. #4. Aims to show how individual differences in children can be catered for in a primary school physical education program. Describes the basic skills of gymnastics and the techniques of supporting, transferring and managing the body weight through different activities.

results.title: Sheep: handle with care. Parts I-III
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development and Bob Scarfe
results.brief_description: A three part program that shows the different aspects of sheep management. Part 1 deals with Mustering, mouthing, teeth trimming, drenching and foot care. Part 2 deals wth crutching, vaccinating, lamb marking and drafting. Part 3 deals with shearing, branding, dipping and jetting

results.title: Theatre: getting your act together
results.brief_description: Presents a behind-the-scenes look at the theatre and the roles of the playwright, director, actor and theatre production staff. Designed to promote students’ interest in the theatre and to provide them with an insight into the workings of two professional theatre companies - The Melbourne Theatre Company and Sydney’s King O’Malley Theatre Company. The program is divided into five sections: 1 What is theatre? 2 The playwright in society. 3 In rehearsal. 4 The performance. 5 Theatre in society.

results.title: Tech Talk. Episodes 19 & 20.
results.creator_credit: John Kyle, Allenog Pty Ltd and Channel 0\28
results.brief_description: A compilation tape containing eight programmes designed to help young people in their carrer choices. There is also a segment on survival skills. Presented by Michael Shildberger, the topics covered are as follows:- surveyor, spray painter, painter and decorator, being out of work-the parents angle, computers - working in the industry, computers - the new age, florist and how to keep that job.

results.title: Russell Drysdale
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Five Australians”.
This film shows personal interviews between Russell Drysdale and Australian author George Johnston. Their discussions centre on Drysdale’s slowly developing portrait of Johnston and closely examine the values and lifestyle of what Sidney Nolan calls “the most Australian painter”. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Australia's Best: Music & Images of Australians in the 80's
results.creator_credit: Pom Oliver, South Pacific Films and New South Wales Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A music video documentary showcasing the best of Australia’s popular music in the eighties. Features the music of Split Enz, Australian Crawl, INXS, No Fixed Address, Cold Chisel and Icehouse. Includes interviews with celebrities such as Michael Hutchence, Neil and Tim Finn, James Reyne and Grace Knight.
